here we're trying to just showcase that in these videos so I have the skeleton

I thought it was a nice color for his desiccated corpse oh I thought it'd be

I used a metallic taupe on the extra pieces I put on the miniature as I

I also found this other jewelry piece that kind of accentuates the back of the

as you'll start to see later as I fill it in but yeah so I'm gonna use this

and then we'll move on to the next step of the project so now I'm stuck with a
nude lip and you know as well as looking gnarly
probably not the kind of thing you want to convey in your game right you want to
have him clothed so how he did it was she used cheesecloth on hers right and
what we're trying to convey in these videos is that you can use alternate
materials or you know change it up so that's the kind of thing you can take
inspiration from a project and then change it up so what I thought I would
do is I would use my teepee method so basically what I did is I just kind of
folded the teepee over and then I drape it over the shoulders and wet it uh-huh
and then I move to the cloak and kind of fold it up put it on the back wet it and
then you can kind of shape it while it's wet you got to be really careful with it
it's really delicate you can tear it up very easily especially on this kind of
thing and then when I did that I kind of realized well he doesn't really have a
front so I kind of folded up some more teepee and then covered up his legs with
it right then when I get it shaped roughly how I want it that's why I add
that 50% water 50% white glue Elmer's glue-all and this will harden this up
light nicely so I just kind of scored it out on the already wet project and then
I kind of bend it and fold it to be where I wanted to dry the shape I wanted
to dry kind of like when you make those Halloween ghosts out of cheesecloth
writes the same kind of idea so just bend it and fold it to the shape you
want and then let it dry up once the teepee drives hard to the touch you can
paint in what I did was to make it even more reinforced and hard I mixed in
matte Mod Podge with the black paint when I painted the robe and that'll
really make it nice and solid the build from here was just filling out more
details first I put a plumb wash on the robe to give a little bit of a under
color and then I dry brushed it with a blue-gray really nice highlights there
and I also added the staff to the hand with the fiber-optic and I also decided
to paint the fiber-optic with a wash with my color-changing purple wash so
